Question.Text: A 7-Year-Old Girl from South Sudan With 4-week history of undulating fever, chills and convulsions. Over time she has developed progressive anorexia, dry cough, chest pain, joint and back pain.

Answer: Brucellosis (undulant fever) - The child from South Sudan presents with 4-week history of undulating fever, chills, convulsions, and multiple systemic symptoms including chest pain and joint pain. The images show growth of Brucella species on culture and cattle (reservoir hosts). Brucellosis is a zoonotic infection from unpasteurized dairy or livestock contact, causing chronic relapsing fever with multisystem involvement including pneumonia, arthritis, and occasionally neurobrucellosis.
